sourcing.instructions: Cd can be sourced from a chemical supply company; Co can be obtained from mining supply shops or chemical suppliers; Gd can be sourced from rare earth material suppliers.
steps: Cd can be sourced from a chemical supply company; Co can be obtained from mining supply shops or chemical suppliers; Gd can be sourced from rare earth material suppliers.

1. Measure 15.0 g of Cadmium (Cd), 75.0 g of Cobalt (Co), and 180.0 g of Gadolinium (Gd) using a precision scale. 2. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry glass container. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a non-reactive stirring rod for at least 5 minutes to ensure a homogeneous blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 15.0 g of Cadmium (Cd), 75.0 g of Cobalt (Co), and 180.0 g of Gadolinium (Gd) using a precision scale. 2. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry glass container. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a non-reactive stirring rod for at least 5 minutes to ensure a homogeneous blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat gradually to 1000째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and heat gradually to 1000째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. Allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 25째C) inside the furnace to avoid thermal shock. 2. This process may take around 3-4 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 25째C) inside the furnace to avoid thermal shock. 2. This process may take around 3-4 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces of the solid sample. 3. Optionally, apply a clear sealant to enhance surface protection if required.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces of the solid sample. 3. Optionally, apply a clear sealant to enhance surface protection if required.
